name: Filter bank
description: A bank of parallel filters or resonators (up to 12). Can operate in Resonator, Bandpass, or Multiband modes. Levels can be controlled manually, via CV, or internal envelopes. Can be played polyphonically via MIDI.

specifications.name: Filters
specifications.description: The number of filters in the bank.

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: The number of audio input busses (e.g., set to 2 for stereo).

parameters.name: Resonance/Q
parameters.description: Sets the filter gain (for resonators) or resonance (for bandpass/multiband).

parameters.name: Attack time
parameters.description: The envelope attack time. The scale is exponential, from 1ms up to 4s.

parameters.name: Release time
parameters.description: The envelope release time. The scale is exponential, from 1ms up to 4s.

parameters.name: Pitch
parameters.description: The filter frequency/pitch, as a MIDI note number.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

parameters.name: MIDI channel
parameters.description: The MIDI channel on which to receive notes (0 = Off).

parameters.name: 1 100 50 % Sets the filter gain (for resonators) or resonance (for bandpass/multiband). Attack time
parameters.description: The envelope attack time. The scale is exponential,

parameters.name: 0 1023 64 The envelope release time. The scale is exponential, from 1ms up to 4s. Gain
0 1 0 The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above. Gain
1 16 1 Controls how the algorithm will respond to MPE. See above. I2C channel
1 12 12 Sets the number of filters that will be controlled by MIDI or CV/gate. By reducing this, you can elect to control some filters by MIDI while the rest remain under manual control. Transpose

parameters.description: cents The detune amount when Unison is active.
